intro: Anisopappus athanasioides, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ability to withstand drought conditions makes it well adapted to its native habitat.
